geneVariantDescriptions.description: SMARCB1 negative indicates a lack of the SMARCB1 gene, mRNA, and/or protein.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Ibrance (palbociclib) inhibited growth of SMARCB1-negative malignant rhabdoid tumor cell lines in culture, and sensitivity was associated with low levels of p16 expression (PMID: 21871868).

references.title: Sensitivity of malignant rhabdoid tumor cell lines to PD 0332991 is inversely correlated with p16 expression.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, DZNep increased radiosensitivity in SMARCB1-negative atypical teratoid rhabdoid tumor cell lines in culture (PMID: 23190500).

references.title: Inhibition of EZH2 suppresses self-renewal and induces radiation sensitivity in atypical rhabdoid teratoid tumor cells.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, Tazemetostat (EPZ-6438) was well-tolerated and demonstrated anti-tumor activity in pediatric patients with SMARCB1 (INI)-deficient tumors, including complete or partial responses in patients with epithelioid sarcoma (n=1), chordoma (n=2), and atypical teratoid rhaboid tumor (n=1) (AACR-NCI-EORTC Int Conference on Molecular Targets and Cancer Therapeutics 2017, A175; NCT02601937).

references.title: A175 / 175 - Phase 1 study of the EZH2 inhibitor, tazemetostat, in children with relapsed or refractory INI1-negative tumors including rhabdoid tumors, epithelioid sarcoma, chordoma, and synovial sarcoma

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, Tazemetostat (EPZ-6438) demonstrated safety and preliminary efficacy, resulted in clinical benefit (stable disease or better) in 38% (5/13) of patients with SMARCB1 or AMARCA4-negative advanced solid tumors (PMID: 29650362; NCT01897571).

references.title: Tazemetostat, an EZH2 inhibitor, in relapsed or refractory B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma and advanced solid tumours: a first-in-human, open-label, phase 1 study.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, Tazemetostat (EPZ-6438) was well-tolerated and demonstrated anti-tumor activity in pediatric patients with SMARCB1 (INI)-deficient tumors, including complete or partial responses in patients with epithelioid sarcoma (n=1), chordoma (n=2), and atypical teratoid rhaboid tumor (n=1) (AACR-NCI-EORTC Int Conference on Molecular Targets and Cancer Therapeutics 2017, A175; NCT02601937).

references.title: A175 / 175 - Phase 1 study of the EZH2 inhibitor, tazemetostat, in children with relapsed or refractory INI1-negative tumors including rhabdoid tumors, epithelioid sarcoma, chordoma, and synovial sarcoma

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, the combination of Zolinza (vorinostat) and fenretinide induced apoptosis and inhibited growth of rhabdoid tumor cell lines in culture (PMID: 23764045).

references.title: The histone deacetylase inhibitor SAHA acts in synergism with fenretinide and doxorubicin to control growth of rhabdoid tumor cells.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, Tazemetostat (EPZ-6438) demonstrated safety and preliminary efficacy, resulted durable stable disease in 2 patients with SMARCB1-negative epithelioid sarcoma (PMID: 29650362; NCT01897571).

references.title: Tazemetostat, an EZH2 inhibitor, in relapsed or refractory B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma and advanced solid tumours: a first-in-human, open-label, phase 1 study.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II trial, Tazverik (tazemetostat) treatment resulted in an objective response rate of 15% (9/62) and a disease control rate of 26% (16/62) in patients with locally advanced or metastatic SMARCB1 (INI1)-negative epithelioid sarcoma, with a median duration of response not reached and a median overall survival of 82.4 weeks (J Clin Oncol 37, no. 15_suppl (May 20, 2019) 11003-11003, NCT02601950).

references.title: Safety and efficacy of tazemetostat, a first-in-class EZH2 inhibitor, in patients (pts) with epithelioid sarcoma (ES) (NCT02601950).

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, Tazemetostat (EPZ-6438) was well-tolerated and demonstrated anti-tumor activity in pediatric patients with SMARCB1 (INI)-deficient tumors, including complete or partial responses in patients with epithelioid sarcoma (n=1), chordoma (n=2), and atypical teratoid rhaboid tumor (n=1) (AACR-NCI-EORTC Int Conference on Molecular Targets and Cancer Therapeutics 2017, A175; NCT02601937).

references.title: A175 / 175 - Phase 1 study of the EZH2 inhibitor, tazemetostat, in children with relapsed or refractory INI1-negative tumors including rhabdoid tumors, epithelioid sarcoma, chordoma, and synovial sarcoma

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Alvocidib (flavopiridol) induced cell-cycle arrest and inhibited growth of human rhabdoid tumor cell lines with SMARCB1 biallelic deficiency in culture and inhibted tumor growth in SMARCB1-deficient cell line xenograft models (PMID: 18223228).

references.title: Rhabdoid tumor growth is inhibited by flavopiridol.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, Tazemetostat (EPZ-6438) demonstrated safety and preliminary efficacy, resulted in a durable complete response lasting over 2.3 years in a patient with SMARCB1-negative malignant rhabdoid tumor (PMID: 29650362; NCT01897571).

references.title: Tazemetostat, an EZH2 inhibitor, in relapsed or refractory B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma and advanced solid tumours: a first-in-human, open-label, phase 1 study.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, DZNep induced apoptosis and cell-cycle arrest and inhibited growth of SMARCB1-negative atypical teratoid rhabdoid tumor cell lines in culture (PMID: 23190500).

references.title: Inhibition of EZH2 suppresses self-renewal and induces radiation sensitivity in atypical rhabdoid teratoid tumor cells.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, CDKN2A (p16) over expression was associated with decreased sensitivity to Ibrance (palbociclib) in a SMARCB1-negative malignant rhabdoid tumor cell line in culture (PMID: 21871868).

references.title: Sensitivity of malignant rhabdoid tumor cell lines to PD 0332991 is inversely correlated with p16 expression.
